Description: Papyrus written with black ink. Demotic legal document in the form of a 'double document', each copy with 18 lines of text on recto; verso pasted down. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Contract for embalming in two copies, made between Pa-wn (Phagonis) son of Pazemi (Pasemis) and Thotortais son of P-Hr (Piyris). scribe. Amenhotep son of Petemin. Date 16 Ptol. Philadelphus, Athyr".
Curator's comments: Acquisition note in Thompson's MS Catalogue: "presented by Sir G. Wilkinson 1834". On the papyrus' frame: "Wilkinson". Thompson MS : "Publ. Revillout. A.Z.XVIII.79, Reich.u.s. p.38. pl.XI.XII, Spiegelberg(?). A.Z. LIV.III" See: Spiegelberg, W. "Demotische Kleinigkeiten" Zeitschrift für Ägyptische Sprache und Alterthumskunde 1918, vol.54, p.111-114, pl.4 Quack, J.F. 2022. Altägyptische Amulette und ihre Handhabung. Orientalische Religionen in der Antike 31. Tübingen, p. 319. To be (re-)published by Gert Baetens (KULeuven)
Bibliographic references: Reich 1914 / Papyri juistischen Inhalts in hieratischer und demotischer Schrift aus dem British Museum (p.38-42, pl.11-2)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (46059) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/46059)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: bleached, loss Black ink Displayed in Room 60 until 1997 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: self adhesive linen tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: fair
